better_launch.tui.better_tui module

class better_launch.tui.better_tui.AppMode(value)[source]

Bases: IntEnum

States of our TUI. The TUI decides what to display based on the active state. See BetterTui._switch_mode() for details.

class better_launch.tui.better_tui.BetterTui(launch_func, *, manage_foreign_nodes=False, keep_alive=False, color_depth=8)[source]

Bases: object

footer_default = HTML(' <orange>^C</orange> Quit  <orange>space</orange> Mute  <orange>F1</orange> Nodes  <orange>F9</orange> Log Level')
__init__(launch_func, *, manage_foreign_nodes=False, keep_alive=False, color_depth=8)[source]

Our TUI class. Use run() to start the TUI.

Parameters:

  • launch_func (Callable[[], None]) – The launch function to run once this TUI is started.

  • manage_foreign_nodes (bool, optional) – Whether to list foreign nodes in the nodes menu.

  • keep_alive (bool, optional) – If True, the TUI will keep running even when the last node stops running.

  • color_depth (Literal[1, 4, 8, 24], optional) – How many colors to use for display. Corresponds to monochrome, ANSI colors, 256 colors, true colors.

run()[source]

Initialize the TUI app, then run the launch function before starting the TUI.

quit(reason)[source]

Shutdown better_launch if it is still running, then exit the TUI.

Parameters:

reason (str) – A reason for the shutdown that will be shown to the user.

Return type:

None

better_launch.tui.footer_menu module

class better_launch.tui.footer_menu.FooterMenu(items=None, *, empty_prompt='---', ellipses='…', highlight_style='reverse')[source]

Bases: FormattedTextControl

__init__(items=None, *, empty_prompt='---', ellipses='…', highlight_style='reverse')[source]

Creates a single line of selectable items. This allows to have menus without needing more space for drawing submenus. Items that don’t fit into the line will be “scrolled” to as the selection shifts.

Parameters:

  • items (list[str | tuple[str]], optional) – The items to display. Items can be strings or tuples but don’t have to be consistent. If an item is a tuple, the first element is the style of the item and the second element its label. Additional elements are ignored and can be used to store additional information with each item.

  • empty_prompt (str, optional) – What to show when there are no items.

  • ellipses (str, optional) – A character or string to signify that there are additional items.

  • highlight_style (str, optional) – The style to use for showing that an item is selected.

render()[source]
select_next()[source]

Select the next menu item, wrapping around.

Return type:

None

select_prev()[source]

Select the previous menu item, wrapping around.

Return type:

None

select(idx)[source]

Select the specified existing menu item. No modulo operation is performed on the passed index, so it must be valid.

Parameters:

idx (int) – The index of the item to be selected.

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided index is outside the range of items in this menu.

Return type:

None

get_selected_item()[source]

Return the currently selected item data. If the item is a tuple it will have formatting in the first slot, its string representation in the second, and any additional information in subsequent slots.

Returns:

The item as it was passed to this menu.

Return type:

str | tuple

set_items(items, default=0)[source]

Replace the items currently in this menu.

Parameters:

  • items (list[str | tuple[str, str]]) – The new items to use. If an item is a tuple, its first slot must be a formatting string and the second its string information. Any subsequent slots are kept, but ignored.

  • default (int, optional) – Index of the item to select.

Return type:

None

update_items(items)[source]

Like set_items(), except that it keeps the currently selected index intact if it is contained within the new list of items.

Parameters:

items (list[str | tuple[str, str]]) – The new items to use. If an item is a tuple, its first slot must be a formatting string and the second its string information. Any subsequent slots are kept, but ignored.

Return type:

None
